# Draft:Thomas Howard Shillingford

Thomas Howard Shillingford, MLC (1857 – 1919), was a planter, businessman, and politician of colonial Dominica. He was one of the patriarchs of the then prominent Shillingford family along side his son Howell who succeeded him in his land holdings and his nephew Albert who he inspired in his commercial success. He was a prominent citizen who was the first to establish shops in each village along the then isolated west coast and set up sea communication there.

Biography
Early life
Thomas Howard Shillingford was born in 1857, the younger son of parents Felicité (née Dangleben) and Thomas Shillingford, his elder brother Albert Charles Shillingford also became a respected planter, J. P., and was father to A. C. Shillingford. In the 1860s his father acquired the 150 acre Perdu Temps Estate near Geneva, Grand Bay. His mother is believed to be the daughter of a Frenchman, the family name originally being D'Anglebermes.
